claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.
explanation: A CONSORT flow diagram showing enrollment, randomization, vaccine allocation, follow‐up, and re‐randomization of participants over two influenza seasons (2018–2019 and 2019–2020) across four vaccine groups: cell-culture IIV4 (ccIIV4), recombinant-hemagglutinin influenza vaccine (RIV4), Fluzone IIV4, and Fluarix IIV4. Participant numbers at each stage (day 0, 1 month, 6 months) and re-enrollment counts are detailed. The figure only depicts participant flow and vaccine assignment; it does not present immune response, cross-protection, or mismatch season data and therefore does not support the claim. Note: Figure is solely a CONSORT enrollment diagram; no immunogenicity or efficacy data are shown.
